column4: anyone else having problems acquiring network address on a wired network?
can you put a static ip address ?
open a shell ,then type:  sudo gedit /etc/resolv.conf &
do you know your dns ip address ?
then delete all contents of the file
then write: nameserver 193.95.66.10 (replace this ip by the one of your dns )
ok then go back to shell and try ; ping google.com
do you get responses from google.com ?
If you do then type : sudo route add default gw <your gateway-ip>
try now to ping your dns
